title: web site mremoteng.COM redirects to malware and other unwanted URLs
author: co-xpts
body_snippet:
Does the web site mremoteng.COM belong to this project?

It - sometimes - redirects to malware and other unwanted URLs.
If it belongs to you please check your ad providers and other includes. Thank you.

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet: Thanks for the heads up. As far as I'm aware it's only mremoteng.ORG, so this most likely will be almost impossible tackle besides maybe officially distancing ourselves from the other page...

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: nope, .com mean commercial, mR is open source project we dont sell it, but small donations are help project :) please report to domain registrar about this activity so they will take actions (I will do also but more complains are better)

comments.author: DougPlumley
comments.snippet: What is the official place to download the installer?  https://mremoteng.org/downloads doesn't seem to be working.

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet: (Pre-)Releases are available in the GitHub Releases: https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/releases

comments.author: Neustradamus
comments.snippet:
@DougPlumley: Yes, download page on website is dead.

And latest version very old: 1.76.20 (2019-04-12) with a lot of CVEs, etc.

Linked to:
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/2721
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/3103
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/1765
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/2028
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/2271
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/2420
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/...

notes: Manual triage: The mremoteng.COM domain is not owned by the mRemoteNG project. The official site is mremoteng.org. Domain squatting/malware is outside our control.
